title: Level 3: Complexity Score
description:
The lab director wants to classify snowflakes by their complexity!

A snowflake's complexity score is calculated as:
- Count how many different character types appear in the pattern
- Multiply by the length of the pattern (6 for all snowflakes)
- Then divide by the number of times the most common character appears
- Round down to nearest integer

For example:
- '******' → 1 type × 6 / 6 = 1
- '*+*+*+' → 2 types × 6 / 3 = 4
- '*++*++' → 2 types × 6 / 4 = 3

Calculate the complexity score for: {{input}}
hint: Count unique character types, multiply by 6, divide by the frequency of the most common character, then use int() to round down.
